âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Problem is easy to understand and constraints proper enough for correct solution. +1

The problem is well defined and easily understood. While this problem could theoretically be solved with brute force, it's much easier to solve with math. 

With that said,
 I'd recommend increasing the constraints so that it can't be solved with brute force. i.e. 10^9. Having test cases appropriately.

Goal
* For consistency, either remove "the" before "index finger" (twice) and "ring finger", or add "the" before all the fingers, where appropriate.

Output
* Please change "with" to "on which".

* Please change "stop" to "stops".

Cases
* Please add cases where M is a 3-digit integer.

Stub generator
* Please change the variable name "n" to "M" for consistency.

Thanks.

thanks, sir... i did the modifications and added more test cases... now i have a little doubt about the best way to describe the output...

"The finger on which little girl stops" or "The finger on which the little girl stops".... is the second way better?
Done.... now with higher numbers people might not be able to use brute force!
Yes, the second way is better. I just want to mention major points instead of every single grammatical issue as this is not a grammar exercise ðŸ˜‰
